urls.description: LATEST INFORMATION ON FLOODING IN MALTON, NORTON AND OLD MALTON Information updated 10:00, 30 January 2021 A flood warning remains in place for the River Derwent at Old Malton. The Environment Agency has now removed the flood alerts for Mill Beck at Welham Road, Norton and the River Derwent at No

tweets.text: Flood water update: The overall position in Malton, Norton and Old Malton remains stable and is gradually improving, but response agencies remain on the ground and will continue to monitor the situation carefully. Update at https://t.co/FfBtmx2340 Flood updates: @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/dY84tdUbbD

Im sick of flooding can the @EnvAgency please look at what the Dutch to control rain fall remember you used to be called the National rivers authority üò°
#ollyblogs #LockdownLearning  #OllyRants #flooding #farming https://t.co/109bZBoZ6S

Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost by definition, we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams".

Let's just check that statement shall we. https://t.co/tAAPJW9Wge

üì∏: Christine Taylor https://t.co/YunT1Gzg04

Unloading after over a week on the road battling the rain and snow. @SonTekYSI M9 & @ARCboat have collected some record data that helped issue @EnvAgencyMids flood warnings & will improve @FloodForecasts for next time #teamEA @DefraGovUK https://t.co/jG3ltcSCfZ

In 2019 @ThamesWater spent 12,734 hours on 4,628 separate occasions dumping sewage into the River Kennet, a chalk stream, parts of which are designated as a Site of Special Scientific Interest.

https://t.co/MbuX4G46Mx

*Stop Press*
The newly updated & 'go to' Homeowners Guide to Flood Resilience is now live! #PFR info
All products and manufacturers have been researched and verified. Very timely. Real life case studies at back
https://t.co/VtA5LbnW5P

@blacksheepfibre @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Sorry was going...... so the land will become a nature park of woodland and bogs, and some grazing. Whilst the UK flys in food from around the world........?

From this drone pic, you really get a sense of the huge volume of floodwater we‚Äôre dealing with at #Malton, thanks to everyone involved in the major pumping still ongoing to keep everyone safe @EnvAgencyYNE @NorthYorksFire @northyorkscc @RyedaleDC https://t.co/IfK1wLilUU

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Those of us with land high up catchment need to increase water storage to slow it running off to ameliorate effects lower down. Tree planting, allowing rivers to meander to reduce water speed etc...

@blacksheepfibre @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Okay, but that sediment would be washed with the better flowing water. I still think we are interfering with nature and we need to live with nature. Thank you for sharing some of the science. Perhaps I still live on a flat earth but I do know water flows down hill. #Thanksfortime

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency If we slow the flow of rivers then less sediment is eroded and if more farmers are able to adopt low till techniques such as Olly and others are already doing, the less topsoil is washed into water courses. The catchment approach means everyone along it is responsible for it...

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Yes I think part of the problem is humans thought we could impose our will on nature but today's farmers (and home owners!) are paying the very high price for that hubris. Farmers need to be compensated for having to store floodwaters and we need to explain the policy better.

If the the @EnvAgency CEO @JamesBevanEA is not aware that sewage is discharged into chalk streams what chance have we got. The @RiverChess has had 79 sewage discharges over a 16 month period between 24 Sept 2019 and 25th Jan 2021.

I worked with the @envagency over 20 years ago. We had the same handwringing over flood funding. Great promises, superb paper presentations, new high viz jackets for visiting politicians to view makeshift flood defence fencework but year on year #flood funding cut, cut, cut.

tweets.text: Our teams have been working 24/7 to help communities affected by #StormChristoph. Thanks to all our tireless colleagues on the ground for all their hard work, we‚Äôve protected thousands of homes from flooding. #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/YXQaxoevsW
@blacksheepfibre @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Isn‚Äôt that what time has always done? Are we trying to change the world too much, allow nature to be nature.

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency ..water flows in a helical (corkscrew) pattern and flows faster in the outer beds (erosion) and slower on the opposite side (deposition). Erosion creates yet more sediment = more problems. It's far too complex a subject to explain in tweets, water doesn't just move from A to B..

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency If you "get it away" then you increase the speed of water flow. This in turn affects the character flow of the water if you like. Slow flowing water is laminar (straight lines), fast flowing turbulent (eddies). The latter erodes river banks more rapidly, in a meandering river...

For the record @JamesBevanEA. Just 19 hours ago the @RiverChess were been notified by @thameswater that they were dumping sewage into the River Chess, a chalk stream.

That is the 4th consecutive day in a row that this has been happening. https://t.co/OJs8JFfkZP

tweets.text: @janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Well I'm 42 so I'm not sure if you'd count me in the privileged group but from my earliest memories growing up next to a floodplain is that rivers flood as they always have done and always will. It's just part of their nature. Flooding there is less problematic now because the..

@blacksheepfibre @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency So why since the rivers have stopped being dredged has the flooding got worse? If you speak to any person who is privelidged enough to have memories of life when the rivers were cared for in that manner they remember life differently.

A first but important step to shine spotlight of transparency on journey to equip @WaterUK members @EnvAgency and campaigners with the tools to identify scale of the task ahead https://t.co/TRP2w2haaO

Today the UK government has launched the Adaptation Action Coalition at the Climate #AdaptationSummit. 

International collaboration is vital to tackle the impacts of climate change.  

Learn more about our role in this thread ‚¨áÔ∏è

tweets.text:
@Heather14710252 @voice_rural @agricontract @EnvAgency Together with solar thermal and voltaics. It is utter madness.
Very very few people actually know where their water has come from.

Good news. Publishing easily accessible data is an important step to reversing the overuse of storm overflows. @EnvAgency looks forward to working with water comapnies, as well as government and MPs, to turn this ambition into action. https://t.co/uj8TgSVsR5

tweets.text: @RiverChess @thameswater have turned the River Chess from a rare chalkstream into a cheap extension of their sewerage network. What is the @EnvAgency doing to prevent this destruction of a precious natural resource?
